pages.text: The $(item)Altar$() uses the power of $Magan to directly and mercilessly distort the field of magic, causing effects to happen based on the incantation used on the altar.

In order to use the altar, one must use an $(item)Incantation$() of a certain type on it. $(br)This will drain the Magan of $(l)all$() players nearby. Further information on how much energy is required for the rite is written on the incantation.$(br2)Additionally, Rites must reach a certain level of $(marked)Item Power$() and must also contain specific $(marked)Aspects.

Both item power and aspects needed are written on the incantation. $(br)In order to get certain aspects for a rite or to push up the amount of item power, $(item)Rite Tools$() must be used, tools or materials with aspects and power. $(br)These must be held by the cultists close to the altar. Materials will get consumed, tools will not. Additionally, the tool power will only increase if the tool's aspects are relevant.

Once all aspects are present and the item power of the rite tools is greater or equal to the power needed, the rite will be finished. $(br) It should be noted, that some rites have an effect during the performing of the rite and that sometimes certain soul types are required. $(br)If a certain soul types $(o) is$() required, it is written on the incantation. $(br)(Rituals can always be stopped by acting on the block while holding the same incantation)
